bill_title: clarify the subpoena powers of the Legislature and legislative committees.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify the subpoena powers of the Legislature and legislative committees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 2-6-5 be amended to read as follows: 2-6-5. Either house of the Legislature and each standing committee of the Legislature may, during any regular or special legislative session, summon or subpoena any person who has special knowledge concerning any bill, resolution, or matter of importance currently before such house or committee. Such summons or subpoena may be issued only upon an affirmative vote of a majority of the members elect of the house or committee of issuance. Any person who is summoned to attend as a witness before either house of the Legislature or any committee thereof authorized to summon or subpoena witnesses, and who refuses or neglects without lawful excuse to attend pursuant to the summons or subpoena, is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 2-6-6 be amended to read as follows: 2-6-6. Any person who, being present before either house of the Legislature or any committee thereof authorized to summon witnesses in response to any legislative summons or subpoena , willfully refuses to be sworn or affirmed, or to answer any material and proper question, or to produce upon reasonable notice any material or proper books, papers, or documents in his or her possession or under his or her control, is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
